title.narrative: DNDi Drugs for diseases of poverty

description.narrative: Global Organisation (GO) - Drugs for Neglected Diseases initiative (DNDi). Tasks of the GO and its role in the aid architecture: DNDi is the only global NGO that focuses on neglected diseases. In close colaboration with pharma industries, academics and research institutes in countries, DNDi developps new treatments for 3 neglected diseases (HAT, VL, Chagas) en developing endemic countries. Coherence GO – strategic priorities SDC/Switzerland: DNDi activities are consistent with SDC core mandate of poverty reduction: most neglected tropical diseases primarily affect the poor and marginalised who have few resources or possibilities to make a living. DNDi areas of works covers the three pillars of SDC health strategy: 1) health system strengthening; 2) maternal and child health; 3) fight against communicable diseases. Management level 1 (SDC/Switzerland): Key results from the previous partnership phase including results from the current partnership phase achieved so far: 2. new treatments available, 3. treatments in registration. Health strengthening activities (HAT and LEAP platform constituted). Management level 1 (SDC/Switzerland): Synthesis of the outcomes of the current partnership phase with focus on outcomes and outputs covered by the Credit Proposal: - Access to treatments in SDC priority countries for HAT and VL is improved, - Health system capacity in disease-endemic countries (DECs) are strengthened. Management level 2 (GO): Synthesis of the outcomes of the current partnership phase. Poverty reduction: New, affordable and easy-to-use medicines for HAT and VL are available. Other donors: UK, France, Spain, Gates Foundation, MSF. Coordination and synergies with other donors: Similar interest and engagement on communicable and neglected diseases in all SDC priority multilateral health organizations (WHO, UNAIDS, GFATM, UNFPA, UNICEF).
